result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie N Cooper

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie N Cooper appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Willie N Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Calendar Call held.  Defendant appearing in Court, Court withdraws previously stayed warrant.  Defense counsel requests additional time to review offer and discovery.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Willie N Cooper not in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Willie N Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Calendar call scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MBC.

Defendant Willie N Cooper appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Willie N Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
